title: Thermal energy transfer - rod cut in half

content.question: In an experiment, a cylindrical rod is held with its ends in thermal contact with hot and cold reservoirs. The difference in temperature <math alttext="delta uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>T</mi></math> between the ends of the rods is varied, and the rate of energy transfer <math alttext="the fraction Q over delta lowercase t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></math> is measured. The results are represented in the graph of <math alttext="the fraction Q over delta lowercase t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></math> as a function of <math alttext="delta uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>T</mi></math>, with a best-fit line drawn to the data points. In a second experiment, the rod is cut in half and the same procedure is performed. Which of the following correctly predicts how the graph of <math alttext="the fraction Q over delta lowercase t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></math> as a function of would compare to the graph for the first experiment?

choices.label: The slope of the best fit line would be greater.
All of the data points would be shifted up by the same amount.
The slope of the best fit line would be less.
All of the data points would be shifted down by the same amount.

content.answer: The slope of the best fit line would be greater.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
